constants.name: Github
constants.description: A Node.JS module, which provides an object oriented wrapper for the GitHub v3 API.

files.description: Files that make up this gist. The key of which should be a required string filename and the value another required hash with parameters: 'content'

ref.description: String of the name of the fully qualified reference (ie: heads/master). If it doesnâ€™t have at least one slash, it will be rejected.

color.invalidmsg: 6 character hex code, without a leading #.
color.description: 6 character hex code, without a leading #.

base.description: The branch (or git ref) you want your changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot submit a pull request to one repo that requests a merge to a base of another repo.

head.description: The branch (or git ref) where your changes are implemented.

commit_id.invalidmsg: Sha of the commit to comment on.
commit_id.description: Sha of the commit to comment on.

line.invalidmsg: Line index in the diff to comment on.
line.description: Line index in the diff to comment on.

path.invalidmsg: Relative path of the file to comment on.
path.description: Relative path of the file to comment on.

position.invalidmsg: Column index in the diff to comment on.
position.description: Column index in the diff to comment on.

private.description: True to create a private repository, false to create a public one. Creating private repositories requires a paid GitHub account. Default is false.

has_issues.description: True to enable issues for this repository, false to disable them. Default is true.

has_wiki.description: True to enable the wiki for this repository, false to disable it. Default is true.

has_downloads.description: True to enable downloads for this repository, false to disable them. Default is true.

default_branch.description: Updates the default branch for this repository.

page.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

per_page.description: A custom page size up to 100. Default is 30.

scopes.description: A list of scopes that this authorization is in.

note.description: A note to remind you what the OAuth token is for.

note_url.description: A URL to remind you what app the OAuth token is for.

auto_init.description: True to create an initial commit with empty README. Default is false

gitignore_template.description: Desired language or platform .gitignore template to apply. Ignored if auto_init parameter is not provided.

license_template.description: Desired LICENSE template to apply. Use the name of the template without the extension. For example, "mit" or "mozilla".

order.invalidmsg: The sort order if sort parameter is provided. One of asc or desc. Default: desc

data.description: Raw data to send as the body of the request

privacy.description: The level of privacy this team should have.

client_id.description: The 20 character OAuth app client key for which to create the token.

fingerprint.description: A unique string to distinguish an authorization from others created for the same client ID and user.

get-grants.description: List your grants. (In preview period. See README.)

get-grant.description: Get a single grant. (In preview period. See README.)

delete-grant.description: Delete a grant. (In preview period. See README.)

client_secret.description: The 40 character OAuth app client secret for which to create the token.
The 40 character OAuth app client secret associated with the client ID specified in the URL.

get-or-create-authorization-for-app.description: Get or create an authorization for a specific app

client_secret.description: The 40 character OAuth app client secret associated with the client ID specified in the URL.

get-or-create-authorization-for-app-and-.description: Get or create an authorization for a specific app and fingerprint

add_scopes.description: A list of scopes to add to this authorization.

remove_scopes.description: A list of scopes to remove from this authorization.

revoke.description: Revoke an authorization for an application

get-events-for-repo-issues.description: List issue events for a repository

get-events-for-repo-network.description: List public events for a network of repositories

get-events-for-org.description: List public events for an organization

get-events-received.description: List events that a user has received

get-events-received-public.description: List public events that a user has received

get-events-for-user.description: List events performed by a user

get-events-for-user-public.description: List public events performed by a user

get-events-for-user-org.description: List events for a user's organization

get-feeds.description: Get all feeds available for the authenticated user.

all.description: If true, show notifications marked as read. Default: false

participating.description: If true, only shows notifications in which the user is directly participating or mentioned. Default: false

before.description: Only show notifications updated before the given time. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.

get-notifications.description: Get all notifications for the current user, grouped by repository.

all.description: If true, show notifications marked as read. Default: false

participating.description: If true, only shows notifications in which the user is directly participating or mentioned. Default: false

before.description: Only show notifications updated before the given time. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.

get-notifications-for-user.description: Get all notifications for the given user.

last_read_at.description: Describes the last point that notifications were checked. Anything updated since this time will not be updated. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ. Default: Time.now

mark-notifications-as-read.description: Mark notifications as read for authenticated user.

last_read_at.description: Describes the last point that notifications were checked. Anything updated since this time will not be updated. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ. Default: Time.now

mark-notifications-as-read-for-repo.description: Mark notifications in a repo as read.

mark-notification-thread-as-read.description: Mark a notification thread as read.

check-notification-thread-subscription.description: Check to see if the current user is subscribed to a thread.

subscribed.description: Determines if notifications should be received from this thread

ignored.description: Determines if all notifications should be blocked from this thread

set-notification-thread-subscription.description: This lets you subscribe or unsubscribe from a conversation. Unsubscribing from a conversation mutes all future notifications (until you comment or get @mentioned once more).

get-starred-repos.description: List repositories being starred by the authenticated user

get-starred-repos-for-user.description: List repositories being starred by a user

check-starring-repo.description: Check if you are starring a repository

get-watched-repos.description: List repositories being watched by the authenticated user.

get-watched-repos-for-user.description: List repositories being watched by a user.

subscribed.description: Determines if notifications should be received from this repository.

ignored.description: Determines if all notifications should be blocked from this repository.

get-all.description: List the authenticated user's gists or if called anonymously, this will return all public gists

get-starred.description: List the authenticated user's starred gists

get-revision.description: Get a specific revision of a gist

check-star.description: Check if a gist is starred

tree.description: String of the SHA of the tree object this commit points to

parents.description: Array of the SHAs of the commits that were the parents of this commit. If omitted or empty, the commit will be written as a root commit. For a single parent, an array of one SHA should be provided, for a merge commit, an array of more than one should be provided.

get-commit-signature-verification.description: Get a Commit Signature Verification. (In preview period. See README.)

force.description: Boolean indicating whether to force the update or to make sure the update is a fast-forward update. The default is false, so leaving this out or setting it to false will make sure youâ€™re not overwriting work.

object.description: String of the SHA of the git object this is tagging

type.description: String of the type of the object weâ€™re tagging. Normally this is a commit but it can also be a tree or a blob.

tagger.description: JSON object that contains the following keys: `name` - String of the name of the author of the tag, `email` - String of the email of the author of the tag, `date` - Timestamp of when this object was tagged

get-tag-signature-verification.description: Get a Tag Signature Verification. (In preview period. See README.)

tree.description: Array of Hash objects (of path, mode, type and sha) specifying a tree structure

base_tree.description: String of the SHA1 of the tree you want to update with new data

labels.description: String list of comma separated Label names. Example: bug,ui,@high

get-all.description: List all issues across all the authenticated user's visible repositories including owned repositories, member repositories, and organization repositories

labels.description: String list of comma separated Label names. Example: bug,ui,@high

get-for-user.description: List all issues across owned and member repositories for the authenticated user

labels.description: String list of comma separated Label names. Example: bug,ui,@high

get-for-org.description: List all issues for a given organization for the authenticated user

assignee.description: String User login, `none` for Issues with no assigned User. `*` for Issues with any assigned User.

creator.description: The user that created the issue.

labels.description: String list of comma separated Label names. Example: bug,ui,@high

assignee.description: Login for the user that this issue should be assigned to.

milestone.description: Milestone to associate this issue with.

labels.description: Array of strings - Labels to associate with this issue.

assignees.description: Logins for Users to assign to this issue. NOTE: Only users with push access can set assignees for new issues. Assignees are silently dropped otherwise.

assignee.description: Login for the user that this issue should be assigned to.

milestone.description: Milestone to associate this issue with.

labels.description: Array of strings - Labels to associate with this issue.

assignees.description: Logins for Users to assign to this issue. Pass one or more user logins to replace the set of assignees on this Issue. .Send an empty array ([]) to clear all assignees from the Issue. NOTE: Only users with push access can set assignees for new issues. Assignees are silently dropped otherwise.

lock.description: Users with push access can lock an issue's conversation.

unlock.description: Users with push access can unlock an issue's conversation.

assignee.description: Login for the user that this issue should be assigned to.

assignees.description: Logins for the users that should be added to the issue.
Logins for the users that should be removed from the issue.

get-events-timeline.description: List events for an issue. (In preview period. See README.)

get-labels.description: List all labels for this repository

oldname.description: The old name of the label.

name.description: The new name of the label.

remove-label.description: Remove a label from an issue

body.description: Sending an empty array ([]) will remove all Labels from the Issue.

replace-all-labels.description: Replace all labels for an issue

remove-all-labels.description: Remove all labels from an issue

get-milestone-labels.description: Get labels for every issue in a milestone

repositories.description: A list of arrays indicating which repositories should be migrated.

lock_repositories.description: Indicates whether repositories should be locked (to prevent manipulation) while migrating data. Default: false.

exclude_attachments.description: Indicates whether attachments should be excluded from the migration (to reduce migration archive file size). Default: false.

get-migration-status.description: Get the status of a migration

get-migration-archive-link.description: Get the URL to a migration archive.

unlock-repo-locked-for-migration.description: Unlock a repository that was locked for migration.

vcs_url.description: The URL of the originating repository.

vcs.description: The originating VCS type. Please be aware that without this parameter, the import job will take additional time to detect the VCS type before beginning the import. This detection step will be reflected in the response.

vcs_username.description: If authentication is required, the username to provide to vcs_url.

vcs_password.description: If authentication is required, the password to provide to vcs_url.

tfvc_project.description: For a tfvc import, the name of the project that is being imported.

start-import.description: Start an import. (In preview period. See README.)

get-import-progress.description: Get import progress. (In preview period. See README.)

vcs_username.description: The username to provide to the originating repository.

vcs_password.description: The password to provide to the originating repository.

update-import.description: Update existing import. (In preview period. See README.)

since.description: Only authors found after this id are returned. Provide the highest author ID you've seen so far. New authors may be added to the list at any point while the importer is performing the raw step.

get-import-commit-authors.description: Get import commit authors. (In preview period. See README.)

map-import-commit-author.description: Map a commit author. (In preview period. See README.)

set-import-lfs-preference.description: Set import LFS preference. (In preview period. See README.)

get-large-import-files.description: List files larger than 100MB found during the import. (In preview period. See README.)

cancel-import.description: Cancel an import. (In preview period. See README.)

get-emojis.description: Lists all the emojis available to use on GitHub.

name.description: The name of the .gitignore template to get e.g. 'C'

get-licenses.description: List all licenses. (In preview period. See README.)

get-license.description: Get an individual license. (In preview period. See README.)

get-repo-license.description: Get the contents of a repository's license. (In preview period. See README.)

mode.description: The rendering mode, `markdown` to render a document as plain Markdown, just like README files are rendered. `gfm` to render a document as user-content, e.g. like user comments or issues are rendered. In GFM mode, hard line breaks are always taken into account, and issue and user mentions are linked accordingly.

context.description: The repository context. Only taken into account when rendering as `gfm`

render-markdown-raw.description: Render a Markdown document in raw mode

get-meta.description: This endpoint provides information about GitHub.com, the service. Or, if you access this endpoint on your organization's GitHub Enterprise installation, this endpoint provides information about that installation.

get-rate-limit.description: Get your current rate limit status

since.description: The integer ID of the last Organization that you've seen.

get-for-user.description: List public organization memberships for the specified user.

billing_email.description: Billing email address. This address is not publicized.

name.description: The shorthand name of the company.

filter.description: Filter members returned in the list.

role.description: Filter members returned by their role.
The role to give the user in the organization.

state.description: Indicates the state of the memberships to return. Can be either active or pending. If not specified, both active and pending memberships are returned.

repo_names.description: The full name (e.g., "organization-name/repository-name") of repositories to add the team to.

role.description: Filters members returned by their role in the team.
The role that this user should have in the team.

check-team-repo.description: Check if a team manages a repository

permission.description: `pull` - team members can pull, but not push or administer this repository, `push` - team members can pull and push, but not administer this repository, `admin` - team members can pull, push and administer this repository.

config.description: Key/value pairs to provide settings for this webhook

events.description: Determines what events the hook is triggered for. Default: ["push"].

active.description: Determines whether the hook is actually triggered on pushes.

config.description: Key/value pairs to provide settings for this webhook

events.description: Determines what events the hook is triggered for. Default: ["push"].

active.description: Determines whether the hook is actually triggered on pushes.

head.description: Filter pulls by head user and branch name in the format of user:ref-name. Example: github:new-script-format.

base.description: Filter pulls by base branch name. Example: gh-pages.

title.description: The title of the pull request.

body.description: The contents of the pull request.

issue.description: The issue number in this repository to turn into a Pull Request.

create-from-issue.description: Create a pull request from an existing issue

title.description: The title of the pull request.

body.description: The contents of the pull request.

get-commits.description: List commits on a pull request

check-merged.description: Get if a pull request has been merged

commit_message.description: Extra detail to append to automatic commit message.

sha.description: SHA that pull request head must match to allow merge

commit_title.description: Title for the automatic commit message. (In preview period. See README.)

squash.description: Commit a single commit to the head branch. (In preview period. See README.)

get-comments.description: List comments on a pull request

in_reply_to.description: The comment id to reply to.

create-comment-reply.description: Reply to existing pull request comment

content.description: Indicates which type of reaction to return.

get-for-commit-comment.description: List reactions for a commit comment. (In preview period. See README.)

create-for-commit-comment.description: Create reaction for a commit comment. (In preview period. See README.)

content.description: Indicates which type of reaction to return.

get-for-issue.description: List reactions for an issue. (In preview period. See README.)

create-for-issue.description: Create reaction for an issue. (In preview period. See README.)

content.description: Indicates which type of reaction to return.

get-for-issue-comment.description: List reactions for an issue comment. (In preview period. See README.)

create-for-issue-comment.description: Create reaction for an issue comment. (In preview period. See README.)

content.description: Indicates which type of reaction to return.

get-for-pull-request-review-comment.description: List reactions for a pull request review comment. (In preview period. See README.)

create-for-pull-request-review-comment.description: Create reaction for a pull request review comment. (In preview period. See README.)

delete.description: Delete a reaction. (In preview period. See README.)

visibility.description: Can be one of `all`, `public`, or `private`. Default: `all`.

affiliation.description: Comma-separated list of values. Can include: `owner`, `collaborator`, `organization_member`.

get-for-user.description: List public repositories for the specified user.

get-for-org.description: List repositories for the specified org.

since.description: The integer ID of the last Repository that you've seen.

get-by-id.description: Get a single repo by id.

create.description: Create a new repository for the authenticated user.

team_id.description: The id of the team that will be granted access to this repository. This is only valid when creating a repo in an organization.

create-for-org.description: Create a new repository for an organization.

get.description: Get a repo for a user.

anon.description: Set to 1 or true to include anonymous contributors in results.

get-contributors.description: Get contributors for the specified repository.

get-languages.description: Get languages for the specified repository.

get-teams.description: Get teams for the specified repository.

get-tags.description: Get tags for the specified repository.

protected.description: Set to true to only return protected branches

get-branches.description: List branches. (In preview period. See README.)

get-branch.description: Get branch. (In preview period. See README.)

get-branch-protection.description: Get branch protection. (In preview period. See README.)

required_status_checks.description: JSON object that contains the following keys: `include_admins` - Enforce required status checks for repository administrators, `strict` - Require branches to be up to date before merging, `contexts` - The list of status checks to require in order to merge into this branch. This object can have the value of `null` for disabled.

restrictions.description: JSON object that contains the following keys: `users` - The list of user logins with push access, `teams` - The list of team slugs with push access. This object can have the value of `null` for disabled.

update-branch-protection.description: Update branch protection. (In preview period. See README.)

remove-branch-protection.description: Remove branch protection. (In preview period. See README.)

get-protected-branch-required-status-che.description: Get required status checks of protected branch. (In preview period. See README.)

body.description: JSON object that contains the following keys: `include_admins` - Enforce required status checks for repository administrators, `strict` - Require branches to be up to date before merging, `contexts` - The list of status checks to require in order to merge into this branch.

update-protected-branch-required-status-.description: Update required status checks of protected branch. (In preview period. See README.)

remove-protected-branch-required-status-.description: Remove required status checks of protected branch. (In preview period. See README.)

get-protected-branch-required-status-che.description: List required status checks contexts of protected branch. (In preview period. See README.)

body.description: An array of protected branch required status checks contexts (e.g. continuous-integration/jenkins).

replace-protected-branch-required-status.description: Replace required status checks contexts of protected branch. (In preview period. See README.)

body.description: An array of protected branch required status checks contexts (e.g. continuous-integration/jenkins).

add-protected-branch-required-status-che.description: Add required status checks contexts of protected branch. (In preview period. See README.)

remove-protected-branch-required-status-.description: Remove required status checks contexts of protected branch. (In preview period. See README.)

get-protected-branch-restrictions.description: Get restrictions of protected branch. (In preview period. See README.)

remove-protected-branch-restrictions.description: Remove restrictions of protected branch. (In preview period. See README.)

get-protected-branch-team-restrictions.description: List team restrictions of protected branch. (In preview period. See README.)

body.description: An array of team slugs (e.g. justice-league).

replace-protected-branch-team-restrictio.description: Replace team restrictions of protected branch. (In preview period. See README.)

body.description: An array of team slugs (e.g. justice-league).

add-protected-branch-team-restrictions.description: Add team restrictions of protected branch. (In preview period. See README.)

remove-protected-branch-team-restriction.description: Remove team restrictions of protected branch. (In preview period. See README.)

get-protected-branch-user-restrictions.description: List user restrictions of protected branch. (In preview period. See README.)

body.description: An array of team slugs (e.g. justice-league).

replace-protected-branch-user-restrictio.description: Replace user restrictions of protected branch. (In preview period. See README.)

body.description: An array of team slugs (e.g. justice-league).

add-protected-branch-user-restrictions.description: Add user restrictions of protected branch. (In preview period. See README.)

remove-protected-branch-user-restriction.description: Remove user restrictions of protected branch. (In preview period. See README.)

check-collaborator.description: Check if user is a collaborator.

permission.description: `pull` - can pull, but not push to or administer this repository, `push` - can pull and push, but not administer this repository, `admin` - can pull, push and administer this repository.

get-all-commit-comments.description: List commit comments for a repository.

get-commit-comments.description: List comments for a single commit.

path.description: Relative path of the file to comment on.

position.description: Line index in the diff to comment on.

line.description: Deprecated. Use position parameter instead. Line number in the file to comment on.

sha.description: Sha or branch to start listing commits from.

path.description: Only commits containing this file path will be returned.

author.description: GitHub login or email address by which to filter by commit author.

get-sha-of-commit-ref.description: Get the SHA-1 of a commit reference.

ref.description: The name of the commit/branch/tag. Default: the repositoryâ€™s default branch (usually master)

get-readme.description: Get the README for the given repository.

ref.description: The String name of the Commit/Branch/Tag. Defaults to master.

get-content.description: Get the contents of a file or directory in a repository.

content.description: The new file content, Base64 encoded.

branch.description: The branch name. If not provided, uses the repositoryâ€™s default branch (usually master).

create-file.description: Create a new file in the given repository.

content.description: The updated file content, Base64 encoded.

sha.description: The blob SHA of the file being replaced.

branch.description: The branch name. If not provided, uses the repositoryâ€™s default branch (usually master).

sha.description: The blob SHA of the file being removed.

branch.description: The branch name. If not provided, uses the repositoryâ€™s default branch (usually master).

archive_format.invalidmsg: Either tarball or zipball, Default: tarball.
archive_format.description: Either tarball or zipball, Deafult: tarball.

ref.description: String of the name of the fully qualified reference (ie: heads/master). If it doesnâ€™t have at least one slash, it will be rejected.

read_only.description: If true, the key will only be able to read repository contents. Otherwise, the key will be able to read and write.

sha.description: The short or long sha that was recorded at creation time. Default: none.

ref.description: The name of the ref. This can be a branch, tag, or sha. Default: none.

task.description: The name of the task for the deployment. e.g. deploy or deploy:migrations. Default: none.

environment.description: The name of the environment that was deployed to. e.g. staging or production. Default: none.

ref.description: The ref to deploy. This can be a branch, tag, or sha.

task.description: The named task to execute. e.g. deploy or deploy:migrations. Default: deploy

auto_merge.description: Optional parameter to merge the default branch into the requested ref if it is behind the default branch. Default: true

required_contexts.description: Optional array of status contexts verified against commit status checks. If this parameter is omitted from the parameters then all unique contexts will be verified before a deployment is created. To bypass checking entirely pass an empty array. Defaults to all unique contexts.

payload.description: Optional JSON payload with extra information about the deployment. Default: ""

environment.description: The name of the environment that was deployed to. e.g. staging or production. Default: none.

transient_environment.description: Specifies if the given environment is specific to the deployment and will no longer exist at some point in the future. Default: false. (In preview period. See README.)

production_environment.description: Specifies if the given environment is a one that end-users directly interact with. Default: true when environment is `production` and false otherwise. (In preview period. See README.)

state.description: The state of the status. Can be one of pending, success, error, or failure.

target_url.description: The target URL to associate with this status. This URL should contain output to keep the user updated while the task is running or serve as historical information for what happened in the deployment. Default: ""

log_url.description: Functionally equivalent to target_url. Default: "". (In preview period. See README.)

description.description: A short description of the status. Default: ""

environment_url.description: URL for accessing the deployment environment. Default: "". (In preview period. See README.)

auto_inactive.description: When true the new `inactive` status is added to all other non-transient, non-production environment deployments with the same repository and environment name as the created status's deployment. Default: true. (In preview period. See README.)

organization.description: Optional parameter to specify the organization name if forking into an organization.

get-invites.description: List invitations for a repository. (In preview period. See README.)

delete-invite.description: Delete a repository invitation. (In preview period. See README.)

permission.description: The permissions that the associated user will have on the repository.

update-invite.description: Update a repository invitation. (In preview period. See README.)

commit_message.description: Commit message to use for the merge commit. If omitted, a default message will be used.

get-pages.description: Get information about a Pages site. (Use preview header to include additional info.)

request-page-build.description: Request a page build. (In preview period. See README.)

position.description: Can be one of first, last, or after:<column-id>, where <column-id> is the id value of a column in the same project.

content_id.description: The id of the Issue or Pull Request to associate with this card.

content_type.description: The type of content to associate with this card. Can be either 'Issue' or 'PullRequest'.

position.description: Can be one of first, last, or after:<column-id>, where <column-id> is the id value of a column in the same project.

column_id.description: The id value of a column in the same project.

get-release-by-tag.description: Get a release by tag name.

target_commitish.description: Specifies the commitish value that determines where the Git tag is created from. Can be any branch or commit SHA. Unused if the Git tag already exists. Default: the repository's default branch (usually master).

draft.description: true to create a draft (unpublished) release, false to create a published one. Default: false

prerelease.description: true to identify the release as a prerelease. false to identify the release as a full release. Default: false

target_commitish.description: Specifies the commitish value that determines where the Git tag is created from. Can be any branch or commit SHA. Unused if the Git tag already exists. Default: the repository's default branch (usually master).

draft.description: true to create a draft (unpublished) release, false to create a published one. Default: false

prerelease.description: true to identify the release as a prerelease. false to identify the release as a full release. Default: false

filePath.description: The file path of the asset.

name.description: The file name of the asset. This should be set in a URI query parameter.

label.description: An alternate short description of the asset. Used in place of the filename. This should be set in a URI query parameter.
An alternate short description of the asset. Used in place of the filename.

get-stats-contributors.description: Get contributors list with additions, deletions, and commit counts.

get-stats-commit-activity.description: Get the last year of commit activity data.

get-stats-code-frequency.description: Get the number of additions and deletions per week.

get-stats-participation.description: Get the weekly commit count for the repository owner and everyone else.

get-stats-punch-card.description: Get the number of commits per hour in each day.

state.description: State of the status - can be one of pending, success, error, or failure.

target_url.description: Target url to associate with this status. This URL will be linked from the GitHub UI to allow users to easily see the â€˜sourceâ€™ of the Status.

context.description: A string label to differentiate this status from the status of other systems.

get-statuses.description: Get status for a specfic ref.

get-combined-status.description: Get the combined status for a specific ref.

get-referrers.description: Get the top 10 referrers over the last 14 days.

get-paths.description: Get the top 10 popular contents over the last 14 days.

get-views.description: Get the total number of views and breakdown per day or week for the last 14 days.

get-clones.description: Get the total number of clones and breakdown per day or week for the last 14 days.

config.description: A Hash containing key/value pairs to provide settings for this hook. These settings vary between the services and are defined in the github-services repo. Booleans are stored internally as `1` for true, and `0` for false. Any JSON true/false values will be converted automatically.

events.description: Determines what events the hook is triggered for. Default: `['push']`.

active.description: Determines whether the hook is actually triggered on pushes.

config.description: A Hash containing key/value pairs to provide settings for this hook. Modifying this will replace the entire config object. These settings vary between the services and are defined in the github-services repo. Booleans are stored internally as `1` for true, and `0` for false. Any JSON true/false values will be converted automatically.

events.description: Determines what events the hook is triggered for. This replaces the entire array of events. Default: `['push']`.

add_events.description: Determines a list of events to be added to the list of events that the Hook triggers for.

remove_events.description: Determines a list of events to be removed from the list of events that the Hook triggers for.

active.description: Determines whether the hook is actually triggered on pushes.

sort.invalidmsg: One of stars, forks, or updated. Default: results are sorted by best match.

sort.description: The sort field. Can only be indexed, which indicates how recently a file has been indexed by the GitHub search infrastructure. Default: results are sorted by best match.
The sort field. Can be comments, created, or updated. Default: results are sorted by best match.

sort.invalidmsg: Can be followers, repositories, or joined. Default: results are sorted by best match.
sort.description: The sort field. Can be followers, repositories, or joined. Default: results are sorted by best match.

get-by-id.description: Get a single user by GitHub ID

name.description: The new name of the user

blog.description: The new blog URL of the user.

company.description: The new company of the user.

location.description: The new location of the user.

hireable.description: The new hiring availability of the user.

bio.description: The new short biography of the user.

since.description: The integer ID of the last User that youâ€™ve seen.

get-orgs.description: List organizations for the authenticated user.

state.description: The state that the membership should be in. Only "active" will be accepted.

get-emails.description: List email addresses for a user

body.description: You can post a single email address or an array of addresses.
You can post a single email address or an array of addresses.

get-following.description: List who the authenticated user is following

get-following-for-user.description: List who a user is following

check-following.description: Check if you are following a user

check-if-one-followers-other.description: Check if one user follows another

get-keys-for-user.description: List public keys for a user

get-gpg-keys.description: List your GPG keys. (In preview period. See README.)

get-gpg-key.description: Get a single GPG key. (In preview period. See README.)

create-gpg-key.description: Create a GPG key. (In preview period. See README.)

delete-gpg-key.description: Delete a GPG key. (In preview period. See README.)

promote.description: Promote an ordinary user to a site administrator

demote.description: Demote a site administrator to an ordinary user

get-repo-invites.description: List a user's repository invitations. (In preview period. See README.)

accept-repo-invite.description: Accept a repository invitation. (In preview period. See README.)

decline-repo-invite.description: Decline a repository invitation. (In preview period. See README.)

type.invalidmsg: Possible values: issues, hooks, milestones, orgs, comments, pages, users, gists, pulls, repos, all.
type.description: Possible values: issues, hooks, milestones, orgs, comments, pages, users, gists, pulls, repos, all.

update-ldap-for-user.description: Update LDAP mapping for a user.

sync-ldap-for-user.description: Sync LDAP mapping for a user.

update-ldap-for-team.description: Update LDAP mapping for a team.

sync-ldap-for-team.description: Sync LDAP mapping for a team.

target.description: A string representing the item to index.

admin.description: The login of the user who will manage this organization.
